wikipedia_page.main: Brigadier-General Herbert Cecil Potter,  (10 October 1875 – 11 June 1964) was a senior British military officer, 'Military Chief' of Belfast and Colonel Commandant of the 3rd Indian Infantry Brigade, Peshawar. A catalogue of Potter's papers described him as a 'quintessential member of the British officer class'.

response: * Brigadier-General Herbert Cecil Potter CB CMG DSO (1875–1964)
*Colonel Herbert Cecil Potter  Brigade Commander, 3rd Indian Infantry Brigade, India
*Maj. and Bt. Lt.-Col. Herbert Cecil Potter  Liverpool Reg.
*Herbert Cecil Potter (1875–1964), British Army brigadier general
